occupation: CEO, Principal Medical Writer, and Consultant at Medvon Media and Consulting, LLC
headline: Helping Pharmaceutical and Healthcare Companies Simplify Their Communication with Quality Freelance Medical Writing Services
summary:
Summary: 

I'm an award-winning writing consultant, bestselling author, researcher, and speaker whose client history includes O, The Oprah Magazine, the National Institutes of Health, WebMD, Merck, Pfizer, the American Heart Association, the Arthritis Foundation, and many more high-profile organizations. 

In addition to my services as a freelance and contract writer specializing in medical, scientific, and technology writing, I also offer strategic consulting and speaking services. Speaking topics include: mental health and wellness, address female leadership challenges, imposter syndrome, and getting unstuck. 

I have researched and developed strategies and best practices to help workers cope with the challenges and opportunities of telecommuting, and I share them through workshops, presentations, and books. I am also available to speak on female leadership, imposter syndrome, and women's health. 

I help organizations solve their communication problems one word at a time by creating high-quality content and by training organizations how to write from the perspective of patients/consumers or medical professionals. I also educate stakeholders on how to empower workers to thrive in their remote and hybrid environments. I am always looking for new and exciting projects and collaborations. 

As the CEO and Principal Medical Writer at Medvon Media and Consulting, LLC, I leverage my clinical experience as a former healthcare provider, formal training, and more than a decade of writing experience to help clients communicate effectively with their target audiences. Whether it is consumers, patients, or healthcare professionals, I deliver engaging written and oral content that informs, persuades, and empowers. In addition, I leverage my practical, research, and communications background to provide expert witness services to law services.

My expertise spans various therapeutic areas, such as oncology and rare diseases, as well as different types of content, such as webinars, e-learning, content marketing, and copywriting. I have also won awards and recognition for my writing and journalism work and have published articles in various magazines and websites.

experiences.title: CEO, Principal Medical Writer, and Consultant

experiences.title: Freelance Writer
experiences.description:
Wrote an article for a major Hearst magazine about sickle cell anemia

For nearly 20 years, there was only one major treatment available for sickle cell anemia. But in 2019, the FDA approved three therapies for sickle cell anemia.

The article explored the potential impact of these therapies, their effectiveness, and potential access barriers regarding the price points of the treatments and their demographics affected.

The article also explored the demographics of the sickle cell population. 

Long thought to be a condition affecting solely people of African descent, the Latino/Latinx community is the second most common racial or ethnic group affected by the disease. 

The condition also affects Southern Europeans, South Asians, and Saudi Arabians.

experiences.title: Children's Book Author: Women in Politics→ Victoria Woodhull, Charlene Mitchell, Patsy Takemoto Mink
Adult Author- Breaking Crazy: Working from Home without Losing Your Marbles
experiences.description:
As a pharmacist who has worked from home for 12 years in both hybrid and fully remote capacities, I understand the full spectrum of challenges remote workers face. When I first began working from home full-time in 2012, there were very few resources or studies focusing on how remote work affects mental and physical health. In fact, most of the books and resources I found centered around how to remain productive as a remote worker with little to no acknowledgement of the toll telecommuting takes on one's well-being. 

Like millions of people across the globe who became overnight telecommuters, I became a fully remote worker unexpectedly. The difference is that I had to figure out how to regain and protect my mental health by myself due to the paucity of resources, support, and compassion at the time. 

The COVID-19 pandemic changed all of that, as an unprecedented number of studies regarding the effects of teleworking on health were published in 2020, 2021, and 2022. This book compiles the data collected during these times along with my personal anecdotes and trial-and-error solutions.

recommendations:
Sonali Pandhe, PhD



I have had the pleasure of knowing Frieda for the past year and recently had the opportunity to witness her expertise firsthand at a virtual event hosted by HBA DFW. Frieda delivered an insightful and impactful presentation on the topic of "Breaking Crazy: The impact of remote and hybrid work on mental health."

Her presentation was exceptionally well-received by attendees, who found immense value in the content she shared. Frieda's ability to articulate complex concepts surrounding mental health challenges in the United States, as well as the specific impact of remote and hybrid work on mental, emotional, and physical well-being, was truly remarkable.

What stood out most was Frieda's practical approach, as she provided attendees with actionable strategies that they could immediately implement in their day-to-day lives. From maximizing time management and productivity to prioritizing overall health, Frieda equipped participants with the tools they need to thrive in today's evolving work landscape.

As a pharmacist-turned-medical writer and journalist with an impressive portfolio, including contributions to publications such as O, The Oprah Magazine, and WebMD, Frieda brings a unique blend of expertise to her presentations. Her extensive research on the effects of remote work on health, coupled with her firsthand experience as a telecommuter for over a decade, lends credibility and depth to her insights.

Furthermore, Frieda's dedication to shedding light on important issues extends beyond her work in mental health and remote work. Her upcoming projects, including her work on children's books highlighting trailblazing figures such as Victoria Woodhull, Charlene Mitchell, and Patsy Mink, underscore her commitment to amplifying underrepresented voices and driving meaningful change.

In summary, Frieda Wiley, PharmD, is not only a highly knowledgeable and engaging speaker but also a passionate advocate for mental health and social progress. I highly recommend her as a speaker and look forward to witnessing her continued impact in the field.

Kristin Speer, PharmD, BCPS



Extraordinary companies find extraordinary ways to partner with extraordinary humans. If you're considering Dr. Wiley, she's one of those humans.

I have been following and admiring Dr. Wiley's work for almost 4 years now. Dr. Wiley's exceptional background as an aerospace chemist turned clinical pharmacist, writer, researcher, speaker, and consultant uniquely positions her as a stellar communicator--not just a writer. Her authentic, vulnerable, and empathetic approach, combined with a track record of excellence across various topics, channels and media, makes her a captivating and motivating force. From technical and scientific articles to speaker appearances on podcasts, radio and TV shows, to children's books (she's about to publish 3), Dr. Wiley's rare degree of brilliance and flexibility shine through. With an uncanny ability to tailor content for any audience, I believe Dr. Wiley's value would be best leveraged not by applying her mastery but sharing with others how she does it.  

I highly recommend her for speaking, training, or consulting roles to help organizations optimize their language and content for any audience. Whether she returns to aerospace or ventures into new realms, Dr. Wiley's unparalleled communication skills will undoubtedly make a monumental impact wherever she lands.
